thread.title: Man Utd news: Jesse Lingard joins elite group of legends with EFL Cup final goal | Metro News
thread.title_full: Man Utd news: Jesse Lingard joins elite group of legends with EFL Cup final goal | Metro News

author: Tom Olver For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Man Utd news: Jesse Lingard joins elite group of legends with EFL Cup final goal | Metro News
text:
Tom Olver for Metro.co.uk Monday 27 Feb 2017 8:38 am Jesse Lingard scored at Wembley… again! (Picture: Getty) 
Manchester United star Jesse Lingard joined an elite group of players with his first-half goal against Southampton in the EFL Cup final on Sunday afternoon. Necessary? Man United star goads Liverpool after EFL Cup final victory 
Lingard scored United’s second goal of the game, in between Zlatan Ibrahimovic’s magnificent double, and the Englishman is making a habit of scoring at Wembley. 
Remarkably, the forward became only the third player in history to find the net in a League Cup final, an FA Cup final and a Charity Shield at the ground. 
Only United legend Mark Hughes and Liverpool great Ian Rush have ever managed the same feat and Lingard was taken aback when he was made aware of this fact after the match. Jesse Lingard joins Mark Hughes and Ian Rush with his goal at Wembley (Picture: Getty) 
The 24-year-old has hardly been prolific over the course of his Red Devils career but clearly thrives under pressure on big occasions. 
Jose Mourinho will hope for more of the same from Lingard as the side continue to fight for a place in next season’s Champions League.
